definition: to retire (from society, esp. from politics)/to vanish
secret/hidden/concealed/(prefix) crypto-
to lean upon
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: Mr Ackermann is stepping down as the German bank's chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 作为德意志银行的首席执行官，阿尔克曼将逐渐隐退。

sentences.english: When the dynasty gradually retreated, its elegant demeanour is still highly esteemed and praised by people in the world.
sentences.chinese: 当王朝渐渐隐退，华庭风采却依旧为世人所推崇。

sentences.english: After his retirement from the official circle, where did Fan Li go?
sentences.chinese: 范蠡隐退官场之后到哪里去了呢？

sentences.english: For a couple of years, I retreated into a life of bohemian bachelorhood.
sentences.chinese: 几年来，我都过着一种隐退的波西米亚式的独身生活。

definition: to fade out (cinema)/to withdraw from (politics, acting etc)/to fade from (memory)
to go back to one's native place and live in seclusion
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to make one's name/to become famous
to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to live in seclusion
(of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
lit. to wash one's hands in a gold basin (idiom)/fig. to abandon the life of an outlaw
show business
to leave the mountain (of a hermit)/to come out of obscurity to a government job/to take a leading position
performing arts circles/show business
to win success and recognition (idiom)
silence/stillness
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
discouraged/downhearted
